snippet.textDisplay:
In the interest of salvaging your waning interest in Pokemon, I implore you to play HeartGold or SoulSilver. Gen II was, hands down, no argument necessary, objectively and completely, unequivocally the best that Pokemon has offered, ever. And the HeartGold and SoulSilver versions (remakes of the originals) did what remakes do - dressed the game up a bit and made it a little fancier. So, if you want to truly reignite your passion for Pokemon, play one of those games! Hell, do a Nuzlocke Run if you want to feel the true depth of emotion that can come from the attachments and bonds you develop toward your favorite Pokemon!

Hopefully this comment reaches you, and you'll consider giving that entry in the series a try. If you do, and you find that they really have inspired you to continue believing in the potential of Pokemon, I would also suggest Black and White (as well as Black and White 2) and X and Y, as other good entries to the series.

Happy training!
snippet.textOriginal:
In the interest of salvaging your waning interest in Pokemon, I *implore* you to play HeartGold or SoulSilver. Gen II was, hands down, no argument necessary, objectively and completely, unequivocally the best that Pokemon has offered, ever. And the HeartGold and SoulSilver versions (remakes of the originals) did what remakes do - dressed the game up a bit and made it a little fancier. So, if you want to truly reignite your passion for Pokemon, play one of those games! Hell, do a Nuzlocke Run if you want to feel the true depth of emotion that can come from the attachments and bonds you develop toward your favorite Pokemon!

Hopefully this comment reaches you, and you'll consider giving that entry in the series a try. If you do, and you find that they really have inspired you to continue believing in the potential of Pokemon, I would also suggest Black and White (as well as Black and White 2) and X and Y, as other good entries to the series.

Happy training!

snippet.textDisplay: i'd just like to add that while everything said is 100% right and this game deserve huge criticism, you only reviewed half the game. Most reviewers are only reviewing half this game. Of my 400hrs on XY, 30 were spent doing the story. The rest was battling online and raising teams to battle online. What you've done here is effectively reviewed the equivalent of Call of Duty's Story mode alone and entirely ignored that the longevity of each generation comes from the competitive community. Games like CoD, Fifa and Pokemon stay relevant til their next release because of their online play; not their single player experience. To only review and criticize(accurately) only the shortest aspect of play time Pokemon has to offer until the next release is kind of disingenuous. No one bought CoD to play the single player campaign and then said "well online is optional, so it doesnt count". Just building your first competitive team and learning to use it right could take dozens of hours. and if competitive battling(you know the thing Pokemon is actually about) isnt for you, then at least include that in the review.
snippet.textOriginal: i'd just like to add that while everything said is 100% right and this game deserve huge criticism, you only reviewed half the game. Most reviewers are only reviewing half this game. Of my 400hrs on XY, 30 were spent doing the story. The rest was battling online and raising teams to battle online. What you've done here is effectively reviewed the equivalent of Call of Duty's Story mode alone and entirely ignored that the longevity of each generation comes from the competitive community. Games like CoD, Fifa and Pokemon stay relevant til their next release because of their online play; not their single player experience. To only review and criticize(accurately) only the shortest aspect of play time Pokemon has to offer until the next release is kind of disingenuous. No one bought CoD to play the single player campaign and then said "well online is optional, so it doesnt count". Just building your first competitive team and learning to use it right could take dozens of hours. and if competitive battling(you know the thing Pokemon is actually about) isnt for you, then at least include that in the review.

snippet.textDisplay: Whatever happened to the story telling in pokemon like Gen 2, 3, 4 and even 5. I feel like  the story of Lugia and Ho-oh or Palkia, Dialga and Giritinia were far more real and impactful. The story of 2 brothers and giant pokemon manifested through some polygon dragon feels bland. Especially the end game where the 2 respective shield and sword douchebags show up. It was so painfully boring and cartoonish. Really takes away from everything pokemon once was. 🤦🏽‍♀️

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly as someone who hasn't played all the pokemon games, I had a great time playing shield. But I agree that they could of done a lot more with it. I thought all the routes would of been like the wild area and I was disappointed with the actual routes. Also dont really know what to do once I'm done with the story and beating Leon. Also kinda peeved that a great way to level your pokemon is via cooking instead of battling. I wanted to get closer to the lvl 69-70 range for Hop at the end and I had to make so many curries. And why is it only just curry???

snippet.textDisplay:
I think this is one of the best critiques that I've seen of Sword and Shield because it really hits home what I think is the problem with the game - it's rushed. And more specifically, you realised why it's being rushed - the Pokémon Company International just pushes everything out and milks the series dry. I always see people hate Gamefreak for this, but Gamefreak doesn't have any choice when the game is released, and there wasn't really any way they could release by that schedule without cutting corners.

I really liked my playthrough of Shield, I loved the new Pokémon (which is always the highlight of a new generation for me). But it's definitely a game which needed a lot more time in the oven.

I think you hit the nail on the head when you said that other series' evolved whilst Pokémon didn't. Whilst I like the Pokémon formula, it has not changed since 1996. Games have changed along with Pokémon, so what was amazing 2 decades ago is old news now.

A Pokémon game which tries something bold and new would be so interesting, and could pay off amazingly (like it did for Zelda with BotW). But it's a risk TPCi probably won't take because a game like that would require a bigger budget and more development time, and they would rather produce as much as possible (quantity over quality).

Anyway, great review! Even though I still like the game, I agree with most things you said.

Except your hate of Inteleon.
snippet.textOriginal:
I think this is one of the best critiques that I've seen of Sword and Shield because it really hits home what I think is the problem with the game - it's rushed. And more specifically, you realised why it's being rushed - the Pokémon Company International just pushes everything out and milks the series dry. I always see people hate Gamefreak for this, but Gamefreak doesn't have any choice when the game is released, and there wasn't really any way they could release by that schedule without cutting corners.

I really liked my playthrough of Shield, I loved the new Pokémon (which is always the highlight of a new generation for me). But it's definitely a game which needed a lot more time in the oven.

I think you hit the nail on the head when you said that other series' evolved whilst Pokémon didn't. Whilst I like the Pokémon formula, it has not changed since 1996. Games have changed along with Pokémon, so what was amazing 2 decades ago is old news now.

A Pokémon game which tries something bold and new would be so interesting, and could pay off amazingly (like it did for Zelda with BotW). But it's a risk TPCi probably won't take because a game like that would require a bigger budget and more development time, and they would rather produce as much as possible (quantity over quality).

Anyway, great review! Even though I still like the game, I agree with most things you said. 

Except your hate of Inteleon.

snippet.textDisplay: I would actually like Pokemon more if it went full Sanrio and just released new plushie designs and sometimes a TV show with them. This model means that we'll just get an unfinished game from publishing mandates akin to FIFA, and maldesigned cuties from the expectations of having a whole new world of Pokemon. I just hope that they sneakily let a department develop one for the next gen and give them the time so they can then pretend like they care and listen.

snippet.textDisplay: I prefer Pokemon to stay like it is. Its fun. Anytime a jrpg changes we get garabage action rpgs that people smash one button over and over like in FF15. Its why they never change dragon quest. Grindy, turn based games are great to some people. They didnt innovate with sword and shield because a lot of their fanbase hated lets go pikachu. I had long time pokemon playing friends that were disappointed with how you had to always catch pokemon to level your team up instead of grinding levels. Graphics, challenge, voice acting etc have never been associated with pokemon games. I  had more fun playing pokemon red on the original gameboy than any game on the market today.
snippet.textOriginal: I prefer Pokemon to stay like it is. Its fun. Anytime a jrpg changes we get garabage action rpgs that people smash one button over and over like in FF15. I had long time pokemon playing friends that were disappointed with how you had to always catch pokemon to level your team up instead of grinding levels. Graphics, challenge, voice acting etc have never been associated with pokemon games. I  had more fun playing pokemon red on the original gameboy than any game on the market today.

And there's me just liking the old' crap I haven't played in 10 years
Like
Yeah it's still just there, waiting
It's nice to have a rock paper scisors still being fun
Should focus on having that side game of charming camping with your pokes, and let the basics be the basics, in my sight

snippet.textDisplay: This video makes me feel better about not purchasing the game. I won't lie, it was really hard around launch time. But it would just make me sad to play and I don't want to support the franchise anymore. Your rant at the end hit hard. It was nothing but truth. The sad part to me is I did my part, but nobody else did and still bought it. I knew it would happen too. It just hurts. I'm not even mad because of the Nat Dex, just the sheer lack of effort. Decided to replay BW1 instead and had lots of fun with it. It's honestly just sad for me. It's not even that I'm mad at it not getting better or improving, it feels the franchise is simply getting worse. There was clearly way more effort put into the generation 5 games. It wasn't even my nostalgia, it was still really fun to replay.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree with this review. All the things that I loved about pokémon disappointed me so much this year. It’s not worth $60, the animations are lzy and bland, the story is fun but just boring at times, there’s hardly any memorable characters or challenges and by the time you reach the post game you just wanna stop playing. Max raid battles are addicting, egg hatching is addicting, shiny hunting and completing the dex is fun, but after all that, there really isn’t that much replayability. Inevitably it feels like their making an Alpha game to this Beta game and probably Diamond and Pearl Remakes, but I feel really betrayed by this company. It’s almost as bad as Disney with it’s insane merchandising practices. Mobile games up the wazoo, paid subscriptions on top of paid subscriptions, and fewer and fewer pokémon now that they just don’t want to put in the work to make them all. Unacceptable. But I did buy them both, so I live with my regret.
snippet.textOriginal: I agree with this review. All the things that I loved about pokémon disappointed me so much this year. It’s not worth $60, the animations are lzy and bland, the story is fun but just boring at times, there’s hardly any memorable characters or challenges and by the time you reach the post game you just wanna stop playing. Max raid battles are addicting, egg hatching is addicting, shiny hunting and completing the dex is fun, but after all that, there really isn’t that much replayability. Inevitably it feels like their making an Alpha game to this Beta game and probably Diamond and Pearl Remakes, but I feel really betrayed by this company. It’s almost as bad as Disney with it’s insane merchandising practices. Mobile games up the wazoo, paid subscriptions on top of paid subscriptions, and fewer and fewer pokémon now that they just don’t want to put in the work to make them all. Unacceptable. But I did buy them both, so I live with my regret.

snippet.textDisplay:
I’ve been a pokemon fan since day 1 and it pains me to see how lazy and uncaring GameFreak has become and even worse it’s to see the fans blindly defending them and making excuses for this lackluster “game”. And worse still is that they attack other fans and call them toxic for being upset and wanting something more because I guess they believe to be a good fan you need to be submissive and happily accept whatever crap GameFreak wants to feed you.
It’s sad really. At this rate Pokémon might just become another Fairly Oddparents or another Family Guy.
Also your boyfriend’s monologue is a mood.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: My dude, I totally agree. I have wanted what is basically Breath of the Wild for Pokemon since I first played Fire Red (my first pokemon game), and it really annoys me that it is totally possible and they refuse to do it. I liked the Wild Area because it kind of felt most like that, but the "plot" wasn't really much of a plot, and the formula is the same. I just want them to shake it up and make an actual game. Is that so much to ask?
snippet.textOriginal: My dude, I totally agree. I'm seriously impressed. Keep it up!

snippet.authorDisplayName: Some Yakuza Dad With a Beard
snippet.textDisplay:
Pokemon Sword and Shield selling well, Gamefreak is just crossed-arms looking down at this so called "Controversy" high up their skyscraper while whispering "What fools... thinking they can oppose gods."


But I digress, this is serious. Gamefreak, like Konami isn't like EA or Bethesda or any other western developer to just stop and notice such a roadblock. They have a massive following, and addressing some issue is not worth their time.


They are a Japanese Conglomerate, if westerners wouldn't like their products, they would have just shrug it off because we are but an extension of their main market.
snippet.textOriginal:
Pokemon Sword and Shield selling well, Gamefreak is just crossed-arms looking down at this so called "Controversy" high up their skyscraper while whispering *"What fools... thinking they can oppose gods."*


But I digress, this is serious. Gamefreak, like Konami isn't like EA or Bethesda or any other western developer to just stop and notice such a roadblock. They have a massive following, and addressing some issue is not worth their time. 


They are a Japanese Conglomerate, if westerners wouldn't like their products, they would have just shrug it off because we are but an extension of their main market.
